title.rendered: Diverse New Book Releases Highlight Theology, Memoir, Historical Fiction, and Crime Thrillers

content.rendered:
Jesus Christ: Savior, Judge and King of the World

North Mt. Tabor Road

The Man Who Built the Cross

Synopsis of the 66 Books of the Bible

The Biker’s Cross

Authors explore faith, personal journeys, scriptural insights, and compelling narratives in latest publications.

TORONTO, ONTARIO, CANADA, May 29, 2024 /EINPresswire.com/ — A collection of new literary works by authors Daniel Ukadike Nwaelene ThD, Margret Kingrey, Michael Goldsmith, Withel Simpson, and Brian Denning has been released, presenting a range of genres and themes that promise to engage and enlighten readers.

These new releases offer deep dives into theology, heartfelt personal memoirs, historical fiction set in ancient times, comprehensive biblical summaries, and thrilling crime narratives. Each book provides unique insights and narratives that resonate on both personal and universal levels.

To set the stage for a theological exploration, author Daniel Ukadike Nwaelene ThD presents “Jesus Christ: Savior, Judge and King of the World”, a profound exploration of the multifaceted roles of Jesus Christ in the Christian faith.

“Jesus Christ: Savior, Judge and King of the World” goes beyond traditional interpretations of Jesus’ roles as a prophet, priest, and king. Nwaelene emphasizes the crucial importance of understanding Jesus as the Savior who sacrificed Himself for the salvation of mankind. Additionally, he delves into Jesus’ future role as Judge, tasked with evaluating the beliefs and actions of all nations during the Great Tribulation. Finally, Nwaelene explores Jesus’ ultimate reign as King over the earth, where He will exercise judicial authority and usher in a new era of peace and righteousness.

Drawing from his rich background in theology and practical experience in church ministry, Daniel Ukadike Nwaelene ThD provides readers with a comprehensive and insightful examination of Jesus’ pivotal roles. His book serves as a timely reminder of the enduring significance of Jesus Christ in the lives of believers and the destiny of humanity, and his diverse professional and personal experiences enrich the narrative, offering readers a deeper understanding of the subject matter.

Shifting from theological discourse to the realm of personal experience, Margret Kingrey’s memoir, “North Mt. Tabor Road”, takes readers on a heartfelt journey with her and her husband, Everett, as they transition from city life to the tranquil countryside, encountering unexpected adventures along the way.

In “North Mt. Tabor Road”, Margret shares the story of her move from Carver, Massachusetts, to Bloomington, Indiana, and the serendipitous discoveries they make along the way. As they search for the perfect home, they are introduced to Rita, a realtor who leads them on a city tour, ultimately guiding them to a hidden gem in Ellettsville.

Their new home on North Mt. Tabor Road becomes the setting for a series of enchanting experiences, from embracing the beauty of rural landscapes to forging deep connections with their neighbors. Margret’s evocative prose captures the essence of small-town living, celebrating the joys of community, friendship, and new beginnings.

With a background in occupational therapy and a Master of Fine Arts in Writing from the University of Nebraska-Omaha, Margret Kingrey brings a unique blend of insight and empathy to her storytelling. Through “North Mt. Tabor Road”, she shares her journey of self-discovery and resilience, blending personal anecdotes with vivid descriptions of the Indiana landscape.

Moving from personal memoir to fictional narrative, author Michael Goldsmith delves into the depths of faith and forgiveness in his latest novel, “The Man Who Built the Cross”.

Set against the backdrop of ancient Jerusalem, this compelling work of Christian fiction follows the tumultuous journey of Josiah, a skilled carpenter thrust into an unexpected role in the crucifixion of Jesus of Nazareth.

In “The Man Who Built the Cross”,” Josiah finds himself confronted with a moral dilemma when Roman soldiers arrive at his door, demanding that he prepare a cross for the impending crucifixion. As Josiah grapples with his conscience and the weight of his actions, he sets out on a profound spiritual journey that challenges his beliefs and forces him to confront the true meaning of forgiveness.

Michael Goldsmith’s poignant narrative explores themes of redemption, grace, and the transformative power of faith. With his signature blend of vivid storytelling and heartfelt reflection, Goldsmith crafts a captivating tale that resonates with readers of all backgrounds. Through his writing, readers are invited to reflect on their own capacity for forgiveness and the boundless love of God.

Bridging fiction with a scholarly approach, Withel Simpson’s “Synopsis of the 66 Books of the Bible” offers a condensed yet profound overview of each book of the Bible, providing readers with valuable insights and fostering a deeper understanding of sacred texts.

Simpson’s “Synopsis of the 66 Books of the Bible” serves as a roadmap through the vast terrain of the Bible, presenting succinct summaries of each of its sixty-six books. Whether readers are seasoned scholars or new converts, this practical companion promises to ignite their passion for scripture and deepen their understanding of its teachings. Its clear print and concise format make it an ideal resource for busy schedules, while its profound insights offer food for thought to readers at every stage of their spiritual journey.

The author’s background enriches the text with authenticity and authority. Withel Simpson, nurtured in a Christian household and steeped in the study of God’s Word from an early age, brings a lifetime of spiritual devotion to her writing. Her academic journey, from teachers’ colleges to seminaries, culminating in a P.H.D. in Divinity, underscores her commitment to theological scholarship and pastoral ministry.

Concluding with a thrilling exploration, in “The Biker’s Cross”, author Brian Denning delves deep into the underworld of organized crime, weaving a tale that explores themes of rehabilitation, duty, and romance without compromising on adrenaline-fueled action.

The novel introduces readers to a diverse cast of characters, including bikers, detectives, and figures from the criminal underworld, whose lives intersect in unexpected ways. At its core, the story grapples with questions of moral responsibility and the struggle for redemption, offering readers a thought-provoking narrative that goes beyond typical crime fiction.

Drawing from a wealth of life experiences—from his time as a bouncer and farmer to his volunteer work with psychiatric patients and service in the fire department—the author, Brian Denning, brings authenticity and depth to his narrative. His vivid descriptions and attention to detail immerse readers in the gritty reality of his fictional world, and invites them to reflect on deeper themes of duty, integrity, and the power of love.

This collection is now available at The Maple Staple bookstore, both in-store and on their Digital Spotlight Shelf, highlighting the bookstore’s commitment to promoting thought-provoking literature. The Maple Staple’s dedication to fostering intellectual exploration and discussion is evident in their curated selection of books.

For more information and to purchase these novels, visit https://www.themaplestaple.com or explore online retail platforms like Amazon, where detailed descriptions and purchasing options are available. These new releases offer readers an opportunity to explore diverse themes and narratives, enriching their literary journeys.

About The Maple Staple:

For bookworms, by passionate writers.

At The Maple Staple, books come alive beyond mere pages. It’s more than a bookstore—it’s a community hub for book enthusiasts and budding authors. Celebrating diversity, they curate books from up-and-coming independent writers, and offer a platform to underrepresented voices. With captivating events and book clubs in the heart of Toronto, they foster a vibrant literary community, igniting inspiration and transformation through the enchanting power of words.

About Bookside Press:

Bringing stories and ideas to life, one tap at a time.

Bookside Press is all about creating buzz in the digital world. Buzz that’ll have each vital message be heard loud and clear. Headquartered in Canada, this hybrid publishing and advertising company aims to share the magic of its authors’ books with the world. With a dedicated team of creatives and marketing professionals, Bookside Press collaborates with clients in building better brands that stand out and reach greater heights.

Emmanuel Laguardia
The MapleStaple
+ +1 647-330-9992
email us here
Visit us on social media:

News Provided By

May 29, 2024, 18:17 GMT
